thread.title: Serial killer gets another look in ‘Creep’ world premiere
thread.title_full: Serial killer gets another look in ‘Creep’ world premiere | Dallas Morning News

author: Churnin
title: Serial killer gets another look in ‘Creep’ world premiere
text:
For six years, Creep has been creeping its way toward its world premiere at WaterTower Theatre.
The musical, which features 18 actors and 10 musicians, making it the largest and most elaborate the company has produced, began as images and music haunting Dallas writer and actor Donald Fowler. Now, many workshops and tablereadings later, it opens WaterTower’s 2015-16 season, and the excitement is palpable.
The plot, which involves the infamous Victorian serial killer Jack the Ripper, defies simple synopsis. What is clear, however, is that WaterTower has assembled some of the best talent around in front of and behind the scenes, from the star roles to the ensemble and the design team that has been working feverishly to conjure a world that meshes the 19th century with our own. Kate Galvin, associate producer at the 11th Hour Theatre Company in Philadelphia, is directing, and there’ll be a Producers’ Circle Gala Preview on Oct. 4, with the opening Oct. 5.
Oct. 2-25 at WaterTower Theatre, 15650 Addison Road, Addison. $20-$40. 972-450-6232. watertowertheatre.org.
Follow Nancy Churnin on Twitter at @nchurnin.
